author: El Dia
title: Ola de fr√≠o en Estados Unidos: cu√°ndo comenzar√° y qu√© recomendaciones brindan los expertos
text:
Se acerca a Estados Unidos lo que llaman una ‚Äúsuper ola de fr√≠o‚Äù que mantiene en vilo a la poblaci√≥n. La misma se da luego de que el pa√≠s norteamericano viviera una reciente ola de calor y un invierno anterior at√≠pico, con temperaturas elevadas.
Las r√°fagas de aire √°rtico llegar√°n a gran parte del pa√≠s en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. Las temperaturas m√≠nimas bajar√°n dr√°sticamente, al punto que pueden ser peligrosas, con m√°s del 70% de la regi√≥n bajo este fen√≥meno.
En Minnesota, Dakota y Montana, por nombrar algunas, la m√°xima podr√≠a llegar a ser de -12¬∫C mientras que en Chicago, esta semana, rozar√≠a los -6¬∫C. Para la zona de Illinois o Nebraska, por ejemplo, la m√≠nima se estancar√° en -30¬∫C.
Los expertos recomiendan a la poblaci√≥n no salir de sus casas durante este temporal, a menos que sea necesario. A su vez, quienes deban circular por las calles, se les solicita salir abrigados con ropa t√©rmica y regresar enseguida.
Este fen√≥meno clim√°tico impactar√° fuertemente en las cosechas y en la vida animal. Se estima que reci√©n en la segunda quincena de enero vuelva a normalizarse la temperatura.
Las noticias locales nunca fueron tan importantes
SUSCRIBITE a esta promo especial

author: Alex Hoegler
title: VIDEO: Las Vegas Raiders Players Taunted Patrick Mahomes With A Kermit The Frog Puppet At Training Camp, And They're Definitely Going To Regret It
text: In a rather daring move, the [Las Vegas Raiders](https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/las-vegas-raiders/) have decided to poke some fun at [Kansas City Chiefs](https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/kansas-city-chiefs/) quarterback Patrick Mahomes and his so-called ‚ÄúKermit the Frog‚Äù voice. Patrick Mahomes has embraced jokes from his teammates about his voice. During Mahomes‚Äô 2018 season (his first as Kansas City‚Äôs starting QB), tight end [Travis Kelce](https://www.totalprosports.com/tag/travis-kelce/) [said](https://sports.yahoo.com/one-way-describe-patrick-mahomes-voice-stuck-like-cookie-monster-kermit-frog-021538374.html) the quarterback‚Äôs voice is ‚Äústuck between like, the Cookie Monster and Kermit the Frog.‚Äù It‚Äôs one thing for Mahomes‚Äô teammates to tease him in a friendly matter, but it‚Äôs probably not a good idea to taunt him if you‚Äôre an opponent. And the Raiders are bound to learn this the hard way. On Thursday, a video of Raiders rookie defensive back Trey Taylor and his teammates taunting Patrick Mahomes went viral. Taylor held up a Kermit the Frog puppet with a Chiefs jersey and a wig resembling Mahomes‚Äô hair, and then they proceeded to mimick the quarterback‚Äôs voice: Also Read: [NFL Fans Are Scratching Their Heads After Jerry Jones Strangely Compared Himself To 3-Time Super Bowl Champion Patrick Mahomes](https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/fans-are-scratching-their-heads-after-jerry-jones-strangely-compared-himself-to-3-time-super-bowl-champion-patrick-mahomes/) Patrick Mahomes usually stays away from public trash talk, but it‚Äôs safe to say that he won‚Äôt forget this when the Raiders and Chiefs clash for the first time this season in Sin City on Oct. 27. Click on ‚ÄòFollow Us‚Äô and get notified of the most viral NFL stories via Google! [Follow Us](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMLHdqwswrujDAw) The second meeting between the Raiders and Chiefs will take place at Arrowhead Stadium in Week 13 on Black Friday. The Raiders‚Äô two wins over Mahomes took place in Kansas City (Week 5 of 2020 and Week 16 of last year). Patrick Mahomes Owns The Raiders It‚Äôs not a good time to remind Raiders fans that Mahomes is 10-2 against them for his career, with a 66.2 completion percentage and 30 touchdowns against only four interceptions, per [Pro Football Reference](https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/M/MahoPa00/splits/). Mahomes is the type of player that you better have an answer for if you‚Äôre going to taunt him the way the Raiders did here. And for the most part, they haven‚Äôt. But hey, at least they‚Äôre adding more intensity to an already heated rivalry. Also Read: [Patrick Mahomes Revealed Political Stance Ahead Of 2024 Election & The World Should Listen](https://www.totalprosports.com/nfl/patrick-mahomes-revealed-political-stance-ahead-of-2024-election-the-world-should-listen/)

author: Valentina Raffio
title: Catalunya extiende los avisos por lluvias torrenciales hasta el domingo | El Peri√≥dico
text:
Cerrar ventana emergente Protecci√≥ Civil ha enviado este viernes otra alerta a los m√≥viles a los residentes del sud de Catalunya ante la previsi√≥n de tormentas torrenciales y riesgo de inundaciones. Se trata de la tercera vez en la historia que la Generalitat utiliza este procotolo de emergencia para contactar con la poblaci√≥n y la segunda que realiza durante el episodio de lluvias de esta semana. El mensaje remitido este viernes ped√≠a a todos los habitantes de Montsi√†, Terra Alta, Ribera d‚ÄôEbre i Baix Ebre, las zonas donde se han concentrado las precipitaciones m√°s intensas registradas en Catalunya durante esta jornada, extremar las precauciones , evitar desplazamientos innecesarios y alejarse de rieras y torrentes durante toda la duraci√≥n de este temporal. Tambi√©n se ha pedido a la ciudadan√≠a evitar todo tipo de desplazamientos hacia les Terres de l'Ebre. En cuanto al peligro de este episodio, la consellera Nuria Parl√≥n ha recordado a la poblaci√≥n que "aunque deje de llover, las rieras pueden bajar con intensidad".
El Servei Meteorol√≤gic de Catalunya ha activado decenas de avisos amarillos y naranja ante el riesgo de que la DANA que esta semana ha azotado Espa√±a siga dejando lluvias torrenciales en el territorio durante los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. Los pron√≥sticos apuntan a que el temporal se seguir√° extendiendo hasta como m√≠nimo el domingo , por lo que se han activado varios avisos ante la posibilidad de que las lluvias, en muchos casos acompa√±adas de tormenta y una intensa actividad el√©ctrica, dejen m√°s de 100 litros por metro cuadrado en algunos puntos del litoral catal√°n.
Por el momento, las zonas con m√°s riesgo se concentran en el extremo sur, incluyendo el Tarragon√®s, el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre, Terra Alta, Baix Ebre y Montsi√†. En Barcelona, se ha activado un aviso amarillo para viernes, s√°bado y domingo .
Este viernes ha habido siete comarcas catalanas en alerta naranja por el paso de esta DANA . En el Montsi√†, Baix Ebre y Terra Alta, se ha activado un aviso naranja durante buena parte del d√≠a por acumulaci√≥n de lluvias ante la previsi√≥n de que pod√≠an superarse los 100 litros por metro cuadrado. Tambi√©n destaca otra alerta naranja por intensidad de las lluvias que se ha activado en toda la zona (desde el Tarragon√®s hasta el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre), dado que entre este mediod√≠a y la tarde los modelos indicaban que pod√≠an producirse descargas de hasta 40 litros en tan solo 30 minutos . En todas estas zonas, las autoridades han pedido a los residentes extremar las precauciones durante toda la jornada de este viernes.
En Barcelona se ha activado un aviso amarillo para viernes, s√°bado y domingo Este viernes tambi√©n ha habido 14 comarcas m√°s en alerta amarilla : el Barcelon√®s, Baix Llobregat, Vall√®s Occidental, Garraf, Alt Pened√®s, Anoia, Alt Camp, Baix Pened√®s, Conca de Barber√†, Segarra, Urgell, Garrigues, Pla d'Urgell y Segri√†. El aviso se ha extendido para toda la jornada del viernes y, en varios casos, tambi√©n de cara al s√°bado. En estos puntos se han pronosticado precipitaciones abundantes que en algunos casos podr√≠an adquirir un car√°cter torrencial . Seg√∫n datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a, en el litoral y prelitoral de Barcelona se podr√≠an registrar acumulaciones de hasta 20 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora.
DANA en Valencia: ¬øC√≥mo podemos ayudar? DANA en Valencia: ¬øC√≥mo podemos ayudar? / El Peri√≥dico
Riesgo de inundaciones Desde l'Agencia Catalana de l'Aigua han advertido que, debido a la abundancia de las lluvias que se han producido este viernes en el extremo sur de Catalunya, "la gran acumulaci√≥n de agua en el terreno abre la posibilidad de que r√≠os y barrancos puedan incrementar su caudal " y desbordarse. Ante este escenario, la entidad ha pedido a la ciudadan√≠a que vive en las regiones en alerta naranja evitar acercarse a los cauces de los r√≠os durante los pr√≥ximos d√≠as. Protecci√≥ Civil, por su parte, mantiene activado su plan de emergencias ante posibles inundaciones, el 'Inuncat', y tambi√©n pide a la poblaci√≥n no acercarse a zonas potencialmente inundables mientras dure este episodio de lluvias torrenciales.
Desde el inicio de este episodio hasta ahora, el 112 ha recibido un total de 845 llamadas en Catalunya . La mayor√≠a de estas, desde el Barcelon√®s, el Vall√®s Oriental y el Baix Ebre. El cuerpo de Bombers de la Generalitat, por su parte, informa de que en las √∫ltimas 24 horas han atendido m√°s de 50 emergencias derivadas del temporal. Transit tambi√©n informa de que debido a las abundantes lluvias se ha tenido que cortar el tr√°fico en varias carreteras por inundaciones, como v√≠as a la altura de Caseres, l'Aldea, Riudoms y Falset.
Cinco comunidades en alerta En el conjunto de Espa√±a, este viernes ha habido cinco comunidades aut√≥nomas en alerta por el paso de la DANA y al menos un aviso rojo activado en el litoral de Huelva , donde se han pronosticado acumulaciones de m√°s de 140 litros por metro cuadrado en tan solo unas horas. A primera hora del viernes, en localidades como Cartaya ya se hab√≠an acumulado m√°s de 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas, de los cuales 70 en un hora. Tambi√©n se est√°n registrando importantes trombas marinas asociadas a este evento en la costa gaditana.
El domingo hay avisos amarillos activados para todo el litoral y prelitoral catal√°n Los pron√≥sticos sobre la evoluci√≥n de esta DANA a√∫n son inciertos pero, seg√∫n los modelos m√°s actualizados, todo apunta a que el temporal seguir√° abri√©ndose paso durante el fin de semana . El domingo, de hecho, el Servei Meteorol√≤gic de Catalunya ha activado un aviso amarillo en todo el litoral y prelitoral catal√°n , desde el Alt Empord√† hasta les Terres de l'Ebre, por intensidad de lluvias. Para entonces hay casi una veintena de comarcas en aviso amarillo y tres m√°s, situadas en el extremo sur, en aviso naranja.

author: Charlotte Today
title: Join the Fight against Lung Cancer, Saturday March 23rd - sponsored by the American Lung Association | wcnc.com
text:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. ‚Äî This article involves commercial content.
The products and services featured appear as paid advertising.
Get Ready to hit the stairs and raise funds for a great cause!
The American Lung Association's "Fight for Air Climb‚Äù is approaching fast. Here with more is India Sadler from the Lung Association and Kim Wilhelm who will be participating in her 10th climb!. The Fight For Air Climb is a major campaign supporting people with lung disease who fight for every breath.
The American Lung Association in North Carolina is hosting the 11th annual Fight For Air Climb Charlotte on Saturday, March 23rd. Participants, from beginners to competitive climbers to firefighters and first responders in full gear, will climb to 50 stories (833 stairs) of The VUE. Lung health is extremely important. More than 1.4 million people in North Carolina live with lung disease, like asthma, COPD and lung cancer. Most of us have at least one person in our lives impacted by lung disease and lung cancer. ‚ÄúI have participated in the Fight For Air Climb to honor my mother Betty who passed away from lung cancer‚Äù says Wilhelm. She adds ‚Äú I have participated number of Air Climbs and looking forward to my 10th Air climbs.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt has truly been a wonderful experience meeting new people and raising money for a great cause.‚Äù
The great thing about stairclimbing is that nearly everyone can participate. People of all fitness levels can join us on the stairs. The money raised help lung health programs like COVID-19 Action Initiative, The American Lung Association's LUNG FORCE initiative, Asthma Basics and Better Breathers Clubs . Help! Join the Fight For Air Climb! For more information visit ClimbCharlotte.org .
Here are the details:
Event information: Fight For Air Climb
Time: 8:00am
Date: Saturday, March 23
Location: The VUE, 215 N Pine St, Charlotte, NC 28202
Ticket Prices $35 registration, $100 fundraising

author: Kit Heren
title: Statistics watchdog criticises Conservative claim that Labour would raise taxes by ¬£2,000 - LBC
text: [ Shelagh Fogarty ](/radio/presenters/shelagh-fogarty/) 1pm - 4pm Statistics watchdog criticises Conservative claim that Labour would raise taxes by ¬£2,000 6 June 2024, 21:41 | Updated: 6 June 2024, 21:43 The UK‚Äôs official statistics regulator has criticised the Conservatives for a claim that Labour would hike taxes by ¬£2,000. Listen to this article Loading audio... The Tories have made the claim repeatedly this week, starting with Rishi Sunak during his debate with Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer on Tuesday evening. Labour have disputed the claim, with Keir Starmer accusing Mr Sunak of breaking the ministerial code. And the Office for Statistics Regulation (OSR) said on Thursday that anyone who was unfamiliar with the context would not understand that the figure cited by the Conservatives is "an estimate summed together over four years". They added: "We warned against this practice a few days ago, following its use in presenting prospective future increases in defence spending." [Read more: Rishi Sunak ‚Äòbreached ministerial code‚Äô over Labour tax hike claim in leaders‚Äô debate, Keir Starmer tells LBC](/news/rishi-sunak-keir-starmer-ministerial-code-labour-tories-tax-hikes-row/) [Read more: Jeremy Hunt challenges Keir Starmer not to raise property taxes as row over public finances rumbles on](/news/jeremy-hunt-challenges-keir-starmer-property-taxes/) Starmer calls Sunak a liar over Labour tax plans During the televised debate, Mr Sunak said that the figures had been produced by independent Treasury officials. But the OSR referred to a letter from a Treasury official who warned that figures ‚Äúderived from other sources or produced by other organisations [and] should not be presented as having been produced by the Civil Service" The OSR said: "Abiding by intelligent transparency is in the interests of all party campaigners themselves and not just the public. "It will avoid the need for subsequent clarifications and corrections and will help build and maintain trust in their claims and statistics overall." 'This ¬£2000 figure is robust', says Mel Stride During Tuesday's debate, the Prime Minister repeatedly accused Labour of planning to hike taxes for the average household by ¬£2,000, claiming that analysis showed Labour has a ¬£38.5bn blackhole in its spending plans. But [Sir Keir](/politics/parties/labour/keir-starmer/) dismissed the claim as ‚Äúgarbage‚Äù, with other shadow ministers also criticising the use of the figure. Since the debate, [Labour](/politics/parties/labour/) and several other bodies have also criticised the figure. Follow the [LBC live General Election blog](https://www.lbc.co.uk/politics/election/) for all the twists and turns of the campaign train and listen live to LBC on [Global Player](https://www.globalplayer.com/live/lbc/uk/), our official app After the debate, in a letter to the Labour Party, Treasury permanent secretary James Bowler said that the figure ‚Äúincludes costs beyond those provided by the civil service and published online by HM Treasury‚Äù. He continued: ‚ÄúI agree that any costings derived from other sources or produced by other organisations should not be presented as having been produced by the civil service. ‚ÄúI have reminded ministers and advisers that this should be the case.‚Äù He stressed that the Treasury was ‚Äúnot involved in the production of presentation of the Conservative Party‚Äôs document ‚ÄòLabour‚Äôs Tax Rises‚Äô or the calculation of the total figure used‚Äù. On Wednesday, Martin Lewis also pushed Cabinet minister Claire Coutinho to apologise live on TV over the allegation thrown at Labour. Mr Lewis quizzed Ms Coutinho on the letter from Mr Bowler as it emerged on Wednesday, as he pushed her to apologise, he said: ‚ÄúThat is a slap down from the Permanent Secretary to the Treasury. ‚ÄúYou have been on television elsewhere this morning defending this, and saying these are Civil Service numbers and that they were not by political advisers, is it time to apologise?‚Äù But Ms Coutinho refused, as she replied: ‚ÄúNo absolutely not. ‚ÄúWhat the letter says is that you can look on gov.uk and costings are done by Government departments, the Treasury, and those are official costings.‚Äù Mr Lewis again insisted that the figure should not have been used and said it had come from the Civil Service. Ms Coutinho again replied: ‚ÄúPeople can look online. There is an official document on gov.uk which has been costed by Treasury officials which the letter confirms. ‚ÄúAnd as I can say as someone who used to work in the Treasury, Treasury officials do not sign off dodgy numbers. They are very smart people, they are independent, impartial civil servants.‚Äù

author: Paw Mozter
title: Insect Sounds as Clues: Automated System Analyzes Audio for Environmental Health
text: Insects are vital to the health of our planet, playing critical roles in pollination, seed dispersal, and nutrient cycling. However, monitoring insect populations can be a challenging task. Traditional methods often involve laborious hand-counting or trapping, which can be time-consuming, expensive, and even harmful to the insects themselves. A new approach is emerging that has the potential to revolutionize the way we monitor insect populations: automated bioacoustics. This technique uses microphones to record the sounds produced by insects, and then employs machine learning algorithms to analyze these recordings and identify different species. Unveiling the Secrets of the Insect Chorus [Automated bioacoustics](https://phys.org/news/2024-04-automated-bioacoustics-insects-gauge-environmental.html#google_vignette) offers a number of advantages over traditional methods. First, it is a passive monitoring technique, meaning that it does not require any physical interaction with the insects. This can be beneficial for studying shy or elusive species, or for monitoring insects in sensitive habitats. Second, automated bioacoustics can provide continuous data collection. By deploying microphones in a particular area, researchers can collect data on insect activity 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. This can provide a much more comprehensive picture of insect populations than traditional methods, which typically only provide snapshots in time. Third, automated bioacoustics can be used to identify a wide range of insect species. With the help of machine learning, researchers can train algorithms to recognize the unique sounds of different insect species. This can be particularly useful for monitoring complex ecosystems that support a diversity of insect life. How Automated Bioacoustics Works Automated bioacoustics systems typically consist of microphones, recorders, and software for storing and analyzing audio recordings. The microphones are deployed in the field, where they record the sounds of insects and other animals in the environment. The recordings are then transferred to a computer, where they are analyzed by software that can identify the sounds of different insect species. Machine learning algorithms are a key component of automated bioacoustics systems. These algorithms are trained on large datasets of audio recordings that have been labeled with the identity of the insect species that produced the sound. Once trained, the algorithms can be used to analyze new recordings and identify the insect species that are present. Also Read: [Ocean Warming Makes the Water 'Louder,' Impacting Marine Life ](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/50098/20220325/ocean-warming-makes-the-water-louder.htm) Challenges and Opportunities Despite its promise, automated bioacoustics is still a relatively new field, and there are a number of challenges that need to be addressed. One challenge is the need for large amounts of data. In order to train machine learning algorithms to accurately identify different insect species, researchers need to collect recordings of a wide variety of [ insects from different habitats](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/1365-2664.14630). Another challenge is the fact that not all insects produce sounds. Some insect species are silent, or produce sounds that are too faint or too high-pitched to be easily recorded by microphones. This means that automated bioacoustics may not be suitable for monitoring all insect populations. A study published in the journal Ecological Entomology found that automated bioacoustics can be an effective tool for monitoring insect populations in some cases. The study found that the technique was able to accurately identify a variety of insect species, including bees, flies, and grasshoppers. However, the study also found that automated bioacoustics was less effective in identifying some insect species, such as crickets and katydids. Related article: [Baleen Whale Calls from Mariana Trench, Experts Say It Sounds Like 'Star Wars'](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/34092/20161215/baleen-whale-calls-mariana-trench-experts-sounds-star-wars.htm) ¬© 2024 NatureWorldNews.com All rights reserved. Do not reproduce without permission.

organizations.name: analyzes audio for environmental health insects

author: @lanacionpy
title: La Naci√≥n / Amarilla anuncia que regresar√° al Directorio
text: El senador Dionisio Amarilla record√≥ el aniversario 137 del Partido Liberal Radical Aut√©ntico (PLRA), aprovechando el momento para anunciar su pronto regreso al Directorio de la nucleaci√≥n, con el objetivo claro de reordenar las bases y trabajar por el reposicionamiento de la organizaci√≥n. ‚ÄúA pesar de las vicisitudes y de que algunos deshonran la responsabilidad que le hemos dado de dirigir al PLRA y no han podido unir a los liberales, anunciamos que m√°s temprano que nunca desembarcaremos de vuelta al Directorio para liberar al PLRA del yugo de la mediocridad de Hugo Fleitas‚Äù, sentenci√≥ en la red social X. Puntualiz√≥ as√≠ que la aspiraci√≥n central y por la cual se estar√° trabajando es en la devoluci√≥n de la fortaleza al PLRA, otorgando adem√°s una visi√≥n de futuro a la nucleaci√≥n. Esto con el objetivo de responder a las necesidades m√°s urgentes de la poblaci√≥n. Amarilla remarc√≥ que uno de los desaf√≠os que quedan pendientes en la nucleaci√≥n es el trabajo por la unidad dentro de las bases, para as√≠ construir una oferta pol√≠tica verdaderamente adherente para la ciudadan√≠a. As√≠, refiri√≥ que sus labores se enfocar√°n en materializar dicha prioridad. ‚ÄúErigiremos al partido que apueste a la unidad de todo el pueblo paraguayo y llevaremos al Palacio de los L√≥pez a un afiliado liberal‚Äù, afirm√≥ el parlamentario. [#Amarilla](/tag/amarilla/) [#Directorio](/tag/directorio/) [#Dionisio Amarilla](/tag/dionisio-amarilla/)

author: people.com
title: Ryan O'Neal's Son Patrick Says He's Planning a 'Celebration of Life'
text:
Ryan O'Neal's Son Patrick Says He's Planning a 'Celebration of Life' to Honor His Late Dad: 'Will Be Amazing' Ryan O'Neal died at age 82 on Dec. 8 of ‚Äúcongestive heart failure,‚Äù according to a death certificate obtained by PEOPLE
By Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle is an editorial assistant on the Movies team at PEOPLE. Tommy joined PEOPLE in 2022. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on December 28, 2023 04:59PM EST Patrick O'Neal and Ryan O'Neal on Nov. 7, 2012. Photo: Valerie Macon/Getty
Ryan O'Neal 's son Patrick O'Neal plans to memorialize his father after his death at 82 .
Days after the Love Story actor was buried next to his longtime partner Farrah Fawcett in Los Angeles, Patrick shared an image to Instagram showing a person holding a drawing of Ryan's likeness. In a caption to the photo, Patrick, a sports broadcaster, wrote that he is "in the process of planning my dad‚Äôs memorial and celebration of life for late January."
"Everyone who should be there will be there and it will be amazing, trust me. üî•," Patrick wrote. "This will be a tribute to the man, his family, his love of boxing, and his legendary career as an actor. I have my work cut out for me because Ryan took about 3 million photos and saved 700 thousand of them ü•∫"
Photos of Ryan's burial service published by The Daily Mail showed Patrick in attendance at Pierce Brothers Westwood Village Memorial Park & Mortuary for the ceremony. Ryan's ex-wife Leigh Taylor-Young and actress Alana Stewart, a friend of Fawcett's, were also present.
Ryan O'Neal Dead: Actor Reflected on Love Story's 50th Anniversary with Ali MacGraw in 2021 PEOPLE Interview Patrick announced his father's death on Dec. 8, when he shared on Instagram that Ryan "passed away peacefully today, with his loving team by his side supporting him and loving him as he would us" alongside a photo of a beach at sunset.
"He is a Hollywood legend. Full stop," Patrick wrote at the time. He also shared a photo of a beach at sunset on his Instagram Story on Christmas Day as he wrote, "1st Christmas without my dad. Prayers up. We miss you."
Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Inside Ryan O'Neal and Farrah Fawcett's Love Story: 'I Loved Her with All My Heart' Patrick O'Neal and Ryan O'Neal at a Los Angeles Kings game on May 23, 2013. Noel Vasquez/Getty
Patrick is Ryan‚Äôs only son from his marriage to his Peyton Place costar, Leigh Taylor-Young. Ryan is also survived by his two children from his marriage to Joanna Moore: Tatum O‚ÄôNeal and Griffin O‚ÄôNeal; and his son with Fawcett: Redmond James Fawcett O‚ÄôNeal.
After Ryan's death, his daughter and Paper Moon costar Tatum honored her dad in a statement to PEOPLE .
"I feel great sorrow with my father's passing," she said. "He meant the world to me. I loved him very much and know he loved me too. I'll miss him forever and I feel very lucky that we ended on such good terms."

author: Colleen Beck OTR/L
title: Apple Pie Sensory Bin
text:
One of my favorite ways to work on several skill areas at once is with a sensory bin . Today, I‚Äôve got a really fun and creative sensory bin idea to use during the Fall months, perfect for your occupational therapy sessions. This apple pie sensory bin is not only a cute seasonal apple activity that is great for therapy, but it‚Äôs a fantastic tool for working on fine motor and sensory motor skills. The best part is that most of the materials can be found easily, and if not, you can substitute items with things you already have.
All you need is oats, red and green craft pom poms, and a few other materials to make this apple pie sensory bin.
Apple Pie Sensory Bin How awesome does this apple pie sensory bin look? I bet you‚Äôre ready to dive in and play with it yourself!
Let‚Äôs explore why this sensory bin is such a great addition to therapy this Fall! Also be sure to check out our Fall occupational therapy activities for more ideas.
We like using silicone cupcake liners to pick up and sort sensory bin materials because it encourages a tripod grasp and intrinsic muscle strength in the hands when putting items into the small container size.
What is an Apple Pie Sensory Bin? An apple pie sensory bin is a fun, Fall-themed sensory activity for kids. It‚Äôs a perfect pretend play opportunity where children can engage their senses while pretending to make an apple pie.
Our apple pie sensory bin incorporates the scents of cinnamon, and the visual appeal of red and green ‚Äúapples‚Äù (pom poms), creating a fun and engaging activity for this time of year! I love this for sensory input with kids!
Benefits of Using an Apple Pie Sensory Bin in OT Sessions This sensory bin is a fantastic way to bring Fall fun into therapy sessions. You can incorporate various textures, scents, and tools to support sensory processing and fine motor skill development . The apple pie theme can carry you through the Fall season from September through November!
I love using sensory bins because they allow for specific skill targeting. You can easily use this sensory bin with different kids on your caseload, and the materials are inexpensive.
Using oats as a base is a great option because they are affordable, easy to replace, and can be used across multiple sessions. You can add handwashing as an activity before and after therapy, integrating functional life skills into the activity. This sensory bin can even be used with small groups to encourage social interaction.
Sort the craft pom poms into the cupcake liner.
Why this Apple Pie Sensory Bin Works Sensory bins are great for addressing a variety of skills. You can basically make the sensory bin work for the needs you need to target for the kids on your caseload.
In this apple pie sensory bin, you can use tweezers or tongs to work on fine motor skills, hand strength and finger strengthening , and eye hand coordination. This type of activity is a great way to develop fine motor skills and hand strength through play ! Scoops and spoons help practice life skills, like holding utensils and scooping or pouring . You can color sort the red and green pom poms (representing apples) to target visual motor skills . You can also hide objects in the oats to work on visual closure and visual figure ground skills. Kids love the hide and seek aspect of uncovering hidden objects in sensory bins. I love to use letter cards, too. We have apple letter and number cards in The OT Toolbox that are a great tool for this! Plus, there‚Äôs the sensory component. Oats offer a dry tactile experience, which can be either alerting or calming, depending on the child. Playing with this bin can support sensory needs impacting tactile defensiveness while also helping children become more comfortable with textures. For kids who are sensitive to tactile input, this can be a helpful way to gradually introduce them to new textures. Some children may dive right into the oats, while others will need encouragement to touch them. This can be a wonderful opportunity to work on tactile discrimination and sensory tolerance.
Use tongs to pick up the cinnamon sticks and craft pom poms. Then, use the craft pom poms and felt strips to make a mini apple pie.
Fine Motor Skill Support- How to Use the Apple Pie Sensory Bin One of the main goals of this apple pie sensory bin is to improve fine motor skills. The activity encourages scooping, pouring, and manipulating small objects like the pom poms and felt strips.
Oats are a great sensory material for practicing pouring, which is a functional life skill needed for tasks like pouring milk or cereal. The act of scooping oats and using tweezers to pick up pom poms is great for eye-hand coordination , too.
You can use the materials and challenge your kids to pick up a certain number of craft pom poms in a given time. Add a timer or roll a dice and ask them to use the tweezers to pick up that number of craft pom poms and place them into the silicone cupcake liner (affiliate link). There‚Äôs a lot of ways you can play with this one sensory bin.
Mindfulness in Sensory Play Sensory bins like this one can also promote mindfulness . A sensory bin is a great self regulation strategy for supporting sensory needs.
When kids are focused on finding and manipulating items in the bin, they tend to calm down and focus. The sensory input helps regulate their bodies while keeping them engaged in play.
This apple pie sensory bin uses just a few materials.
Apple Pie Sensory Bin Materials Here are the materials we used for our apple pie sensory bin:
Oats Red and green craft pom poms ‚Äì Amazon affiliate link (as ‚Äúapples‚Äù) Here are more craft pom pom activities ! Colored silicone cupcake liners (Amazon affiliate link) for sorting. Using the silicone cupcake liners are nice because they are more sturdy and you can reuse them over and over again. Cinnamon sticks (for scent) Tweezers or tongs Felt pieces cut into strips (for pretend pie crust) Low tray or container Feel free to adapt or substitute materials to fit what you have on hand or to meet the specific needs of your clients.
I like using a low tray to hold the sensory bin materials because it allows kids to play while keeping the materials inside the bin.
How to Set Up the Apple Pie Sensory Bin 1. Prepare your tray or bin by pouring in the oats. (Kids can help to set this up and work on pouring and scooping skills, too!)
2. Add the red and green pom poms, cinnamon sticks, and felt strips.
3. Provide tools like tweezers or tongs for picking up the pom poms, and silicone cupcake liners (affiliate link) for sorting.
4. Let the children explore the materials, build their ‚Äúapple pie,‚Äù and engage in pretend play.
The setup is simple, but the benefits are extensive!
This is such an easy sensory bin to make, and kids love it during the Fall months.
Tips for Supporting Fine Motor Skills To target specific fine motor needs, you can adapt the sensory bin by adjusting the tools and materials. For example:
Use different sizes of tweezers or tongs based on the child‚Äôs skill level. Provide smaller or larger pom poms for different levels of difficulty. Use a variety of scoops to adjust the challenge of picking up and pouring oats. We like to use an apple pie sensory bin and use it over and over again throughout the Fall.
Variations for the Apple Pie Sensory Bin You can easily modify this activity for various ages and abilities. For example, larger tweezers or scoops might be appropriate for younger children, while smaller tools could challenge older kids. You can even add letters or numbers hidden in the bin to encourage literacy skills.
Safety Tips when using an Apple Pie Sensory Bin in OT Always consider the child‚Äôs safety and abilities when using a sensory bin. Some kids may try to put small items, like pom poms, in their mouths, or throw materials. For those children, you may need to modify the bin, such as using larger manipulatives or skipping small tools altogether. Supervision is key during sensory play , especially with small or scented items like cinnamon sticks.
Choking Hazard- This, and all sensory bins should be designed with the age of the children in mind. Many items typically used in sensory bins can pose a choking risk for babies and toddlers, and other ages of children who may put things in their mouth due to cognition or sensory need. For children under three and those individuals with cognition or sensory needs, be sure to use larger, safe items that don‚Äôt have small parts and are safe if mouthed or chewed on.
Allergies- Some children with allergies may also react to creams or products scented with nut oils. Additionally, children can have allergies to environmental materials like cinnamon, oats, or other common sensory materials like grass or leaves. To avoid any reactions, ensure that none of these allergens are included in your sensory bins. If using this apple sensory bin with your students, double and triple check allergies beforehand.
Apple Pie Sensory Bin FAQ What age is this sensory bin appropriate for?
This sensory bin can be adapted for a wide range of ages, from toddlers to school-aged children, by modifying the materials and tools used.
How do you minimize the mess with this apple sensory bin?
You can minimize the mess by placing the sensory bin on a large plastic bag, shower curtain liner, or mat on a floor that‚Äôs easy to clean. Another option is to take the sensory bin outside. Shower curtain liners are an affordable option and can be found at the dollar store.
If you want to give this apple pie sensory bin a try, go ahead and have fun with it! You can use it as part of your Fall therapy toolkit to engage kids in sensory play and support their fine motor skills.
This sensory bin goes really well with our Apple Therapy Kit . You can use the items in the kit in the sensory bin. We also have many other apple themed activates inside The OT Toolbox Membership Club .
Click here to purchase a copy of The Apple Therapy Kit .
Colleen Beck, OTR/L has been an occupational therapist since 2000, working in school-based, hand therapy, outpatient peds, EI, and SNF. Colleen created The OT Toolbox to inspire therapists, teachers, and parents with easy and fun tools to help children thrive. Read her story about going from an OT making $3/hour (after paying for kids‚Äô childcare) to a full-time OT resource creator for millions of readers. Want to collaborate? Send an email to contact@theottoolbox.com.
